summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 concerning the planning, approval, and execution of the arrest operation for Ghislaine Maxwell. It details logistical coordination, cost approvals, and real-time updates on her location and the execution of a search warrant.

persons.name: SSA - Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.context: The primary correspondent requesting updates on the arrest operation, asking for a Significant Case Notification (SCN) to be submitted upon arrest, and requesting cost estimates.

persons.name: SSA- FBI New York
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent, New York Field Office
persons.context: The primary agent on the ground coordinating the arrest operation. Provides updates on target location, search warrant status, and arrest execution.

connections.person2: SSA - Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
connections.description: Professional correspondence and coordination regarding the arrest operation for Ghislaine Maxwell. The New York SSA provides operational updates to the HQ-based SSA.
The New York SSA requests and receives approval for travel expenses and operational plans from M, who appears to be a supervising or budget authority.

events.title: Location Intelligence on Maxwell's Phone
events.description: FBI agents report that historical data from a phone indicates Ghislaine Maxwell is located in New Hampshire, causing a shift in operational planning.

events.title: Travel Approval for Arrest Operation
events.description: Approval is granted for travel and expenses for a team of approximately 3-4 agents to arrest a target (understood to be Ghislaine Maxwell) believed to be in Massachusetts.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant and Arrest
events.description: Agents await the signing of a search warrant, then execute it. The target (Ghislaine Maxwell) is taken into custody.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively tracking Ghislaine Maxwell's location via her phone's historical data in late June 2020, initially pinpointing New Hampshire.
The arrest operation required shifting technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone, indicating a multi-state effort.
A search warrant was executed at the property where Maxwell was located prior to her arrest on or around July 2, 2020.
Internal FBI emails show detailed logistical planning and budget approval (using EAN 564339.1) for the travel and arrest of a high-profile target in the Epstein investigation.
